chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nikkita N. Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Threat to Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber for RECAP only 
Upon successful completion of RECAP defendant may petition for remaining conditional time to be stayed

records.addlTxt: 1:43 PM Defendant Nikkita N. Green in court, in custody.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman in court for Nikkita N. Green.  Attorney Mason C Braunschweig in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2. Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2. Defendant waives his right to a presentence investigation. Court orders 3 years probation,12 months jail with huber for RECAP only and may petition upon successful completion of RECAP for stay on remaining conditional time, costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit 3 days.
